meanings.def: used when giving information that you expect other people to know already or agree with
examples: Obviously, we don't want to spend too much money.
Diet and exercise are obviously important.
I wanted to do well, obviously, but I wasn't nervous because I don't see exams as the be all and end all.
She responded 'Oh well, obviously I disagree with him'.
This massive storm obviously had a huge impact on air travellers.

meanings.def: used to say that a particular situation or fact is easy to see or understand
examples: ‘I didn't realise it was a formal occasion.’ ‘Obviously!’ (= I can see by the way you are dressed)
This story is so obviously false that Matthew doesn't bother to refute it.
